title: Display Guard position as not available on the sign-up page

requirements.text: On the public sign-up page (SignUpPage.tsx), mark the 'Guard' position as unavailable: disable the Guard option in the position selector, display a visible 'Not Available' label or badge next to it, and prevent users from submitting the form with Guard selected.

quotes: make on the website that that guard is not available

acceptanceCriteria: The Guard option in the position dropdown/selector is visually marked as 'Not Available' (e.g., greyed out with a badge or label).
The Guard option is disabled and cannot be selected by the user.
If a user somehow has Guard selected, form submission is blocked with a clear message indicating the position is unavailable.
All other positions remain selectable and unaffected.

requirements.text: Update the HeroSection stats bar (HeroSection.tsx) to reflect that the Guard position is currently unavailable, so that the public-facing branding is consistent with the sign-up form restriction.

quotes: make on the website that that guard is not available

acceptanceCriteria: The stats bar or positions display in the hero section shows Guard as 'Unavailable' or 'Closed'.
Other open positions are still shown as available.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not change the backend data model or stored sign-up records.
nonGoals: Adding a backend flag or admin toggle for position availability.
Removing the Guard position permanently from the codebase.
